intro: Ophidion parvum, commonly known as the small sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body and lack of a shell. The organism is typically translucent or pale in color, with a distinctive, undulating body shape. It feeds primarily on algae and other microscopic organisms, using a radula to scrape food from surfaces. Ophidion parvum plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various marine predators.
